I2C SVT UVM Documentation - CoverGroup Reference

Functional Covergroups for Product: i2c_svt
Covergroup Description
ack_for_device_id_bytes Covergroup : ack_for_device_id_bytes

Coverpoint :

  • ack_for_device_id_bytes : Captures the ack/nacl bit for each of the device id bytes sent by the slave
bit_level_addr_stretch Covergroup : bit_level_addr_stretch

Coverpoint :

  • bit_level_addr_stretch : Captures the number of clock cycles for which slave stretches SCL after each bit in address phase
bit_level_data_stretch Covergroup : bit_level_data_stretch

Coverpoint :

  • bit_level_data_stretch : Captures the number of clock cycles for which slave stretches SCL after each bit in data phase
byte_level_stretch Covergroup : byte_level_stretch

Coverpoint :

  • byte_level_stretch : Captures the number of clock cycles for which slave stretches SCL after each data byte
master_xacts Covergroup : master_xacts

Coverpoints :

  • command : Captures the command sent by master (READ, WRITE or GENERAL CALL)
  • addr_10_bit : Captures whether master has sent 7bit or 10bit slave address
  • data_size : Captures the number of data bytes transmitted
  • start_byte : Captures whether START BYTE is sent or not
  • sr_or_p_gen : Captures whether master sends REPEATED START or STOP after getting NACK from slave
  • second_byte_gen_call : Captures the value of second byte of GEN_CALL
  • slave_address_7bit : Captures 7-bit slave addresses
  • slave_address_10bit : Captures 10-bit slave addresses
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_7bit : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 7-bit address
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p_10bit : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte, sr_or_p with 10-bit address
  • cross_cmd_start_sr_or_p : Cross coverpoint of command, start byte and sr_or_p (including GENERAL CALL)
nack_addr Covergroup : nack_addr

Coverpoint :

  • nack_addr : Captures whether slave sends NACK in address phase
nack_data Covergroup : nack_data

Coverpoint :

  • nack_data : Captures whether slave sends NACK in data phase and for which data byte
scenario_sequence Covergroup : scenario_sequence

Coverpoints :

  • command_seq : Captures the scenario WRITE followed by READ followed by GENERAL CALL WRITE-->READ-->GENERAL CALL
  • addr_7b_10b : Captures whether master has sent 7bit slave address followed by 10bit slave address
  • write_7b_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by WRITE command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_read_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_read_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_7b_read_7b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(7 bit addressing) followed by READ command (7 bit addresssing)
  • write_10b_read_10b : Captures whether master has sent WRITE command(10 bit addressing) followed by READ command (10 bit addresssing)

Product: i2c_svt - Other Coverage Details:

cg_smbus_master_arp_state
cg_smbus_master_packet
